page.title: 15QUARRYING ON MENDIP PROBLEMS
page.content: West Mendip is an{AREA OF OUTSTANDING {NATURAL BEAUTY.}Its distinctive landscape makes it popular with tourists & walkers. Many distinctive plants are preserved in{Conservation {Areas.} Quarrying causes a massive destruction of this special landscape and even screening of the workings cannot hide the huge permanent scar. Some cave systems with beautiful formations are also destroyed. People find the noise, dust & heavy lorries on narrow access roads a great nuisance. It is sometimes argued that quarrying in West Mendip should be restricted. Perhaps the more expensive{ {"Constuctive Quarrying"}_downwards rather than sideways_should be practised.
